intro: Calyptranthes mayarensis, commonly known as the Mayari calyptranthe, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of eastern Panama and western Colombia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically elliptical with a glossy surface and a slightly serrated edge. Calyptranthes mayarensis is often found in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests.
